Node.definition: = marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body; ► plays an important role in actions like speaking, blowing, kissing, biting, tasting, and chewing
= state in which humans are morally and ethically right
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

Node.gloss: to keep alive|to restore to life
Node.definition: = to cause an object to become or remain alive and well; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in most cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation
= action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= a linker indicating that two propositions are proportional to one another in quantity, frequency, intensity, or content
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= causative action by which humans fashion a substance like clay into an object

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death
= causative process by which a specific event causes someone else to be in deep distress
= constraining influence on someone

Node.gloss: to be heavy|to be serious|to be grievous|to be burdensome|to be strong
Node.definition: = state in which an event is weighing heavily on the mind of those undergoing it
= particle limiting the focus to one phrase and so enhancing its truth value

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
literally: pure; hence: = state in which people are without any moral contamination
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= state in which humans are clean in the sense of not being stained by morally and/or ethically unacceptable behavior
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= causative action by which humans or deities use their influence or authority to keep something from happening
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= a wooden structure with holes for securing a person’s feet and hands, in which criminals are locked

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= process by which humans or deities perceive with their minds
= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment
= series of pictures or events in mind of sleeping person; ≈ associated with things that disappear in a moment
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
literally: to fall (upon someone); hence: = process by which humans are affected by a certain condition, emotion, or supernatural influence
= state in which humans are deeply asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with having dreams and visions, sometimes with being inactive
= state in which humans are sleeping relatively lightly; ≈ sometimes associated with being inactive
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

Node.gloss: to uncover (someone's) ear(s) > to open (someone's) ear(s)
Node.definition: literally: to uncover (someone's) ear(s); hence: = causative action by which a deity enables a human being to hear certain things, as that person's ears had been covered before
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
literally: to put a seal on an event; hence: = causative action by which a deity affirms or proves that an event is true and authentic, ◄ as if authenticating it with a seal
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
literally: to cover (a certain attitude from someone); hence, probably: = causative action by which deities prevent humans from adopting a certain atittude
= causative action by which humans or deities keep (other) humans from performing a particular event

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= always occurs parallel to נֶפֶשׁ ; literally: (someone's) life, though used in such a way that that life represents the entire person who owns it
meaning unsure; possibly: = river that forms the boundary between the world of the living and the world of the dead
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
= state in which humans are physically wounded
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
= state of not being subject to change
= process by which someone reacts with a strong distaste to the present of some substance
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= always occurs parallel to נֶפֶשׁ ; literally: (someone's) life, though used in such a way that that life represents the entire person who owns it

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= something desirable

Node.gloss: to be ravaged|to be consumed|to waste away
Node.definition: literally: to be finished; hence: = process by which objects are heavily damaged to the extent that they are almost gone
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= process or action by which living creatures perceive something with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= always occurs parallel to נֶפֶשׁ ; literally: (someone's) life, though used in such a way that that life represents the entire person who owns it

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

Node.gloss: to act as a spokesman|to act as a mediator
Node.definition: to act as an intermediary for a party for communicating with another, physically or hierarchically remote, party
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= pertaining to being a thousand in number or to happening a thousand times
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans are morally and ethically right

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to go down (to the netherworld)|to die
Node.definition: literally: to go down (to the netherworld, death, the pit, the dust, silence, etc.); hence: = process by which humans die and descend into the world of the dead
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= a sum of money demanded or paid, either legally or illegally, in exchange for a service, or in exchange for someone's freedom or someone's life
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
literally: to return (to a former state); hence: = process by which an object is restored to its original state
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which humans are still relatively young; ≈ associated with strength but also with reckless living
= action by which humans ask a deity earnestly to do something
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to see (someone's) face > to be in (someone's) presence
Node.definition: literally: to see (someone's) face; hence: = state in which humans are in the close presence of someone of a higher social status, such as a ruler, or even God himself
= loud sound ◄ produced either by the human voice or by musical instruments ► used to express an emotion or to communicate something to a community
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities restore a certain former condition or relation
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which humans make a statement

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state in which an event is morally and ethically right
= causative action by which humans cause an event to be flawed

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= always occurs parallel to נֶפֶשׁ ; literally: (someone's) life, though used in such a way that that life represents the entire person who owns it

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
literally: to bring back (someone's) life from the pit; hence: = causative action by which deities brings humans back to life

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to cause to shine|to give light to|to light up|radiant|resplendent
Node.definition: = action that causes something to emit or to reflect light; ≈ associated with well being and wisdom

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

Node.gloss: to clear|to justify|to lead to righteousness
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make efforts to ensure that other humans are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior, either in an absolute sense or relative to someone else
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= to impart knowledge to someone else
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
